intro: Retiniphyllum scabrum var. erythranthum, commonly known as the scarlet-flowered retiniphyllum, is a rare and unique plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive, waxy leaves that are covered in a fine, scaly texture, giving it a rugged appearance. The plant produces striking red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters, adding vibrant color to its natural habitat. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological needs, it is considered a conservation concern in its native range.
